text:
Wall Street, south side, west from and including Hanover Street, showing the Custom House. This structure was originally the Merchants Exchange. About the turn of the century it became the present National City Bank.

This photo is a duplicate of a print included in this collection.

1886

Gift Thru New York Historical Society

Wall Street, south side, west from and including Hanover Street.
1887-1888.

Ewing Galloway.

First bldg is National City Bank.

Hanover Street, south from Wall to Beaver Streets, showing the building of Brown Bros. & Co. (left foreground). Hanover Street at Exchange Place, makes a bend in an easterly direction, thereby hiding from view, the east side of the street, and exposing the west side.

March 27, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Hanover Street, south from Wall Street to Exchange Place, showing (right), a portion of the National City Bank building and (left), a portion of the new Wall and Hanover building. Also shown (under demolition) is the Canadian Bank of Commerce building, at the N.W. corner of Exchange Place and Hanover Street. At the top foreground of the view, is visible part of a foot bridge, connecting the National City Bank with the Wall and Hanover buildings.

September 12 1929

P.L.Sperr

59 Wall Street, (Wall and Hanover Building), Hanover Street, east side, from Wall to Beaver Streets. (general view southwestward).

A set of three views from the above location overlooking financial and business structures on Broad Street and Broadway. Across, from left to right these are; the International Telephone Building (flag atop), the Standard Oil Building, the Fred French Building; and the Equitable Trust Co. Building. The last of these is partially obscuring the Columbia Trust Co. Building.

Wall Street is on the right and does not appear. Thru the center of View 2 is Exchange Place. In the background is the North (Hudson) River and the Jersey shore;

View : 1 May 13, 1929
View : 2 and 3 June 26, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Southwest.

title: General view - Wall Street - Southwest.

text:
59 Wall Street (The Wall and Hanover (Brown Bros.) Building): Hanover Street, east side, from Wall to Beaver Streets (general view southeastward).

Shown is Coenties Slip and vicinity as viewed from the above location. Note the "El" making a loop at same after passing down Pearl (foreground) and continuing southward on Front Street. The large structure seen on the left is the Seamens Church Institute, silhouetted against East River piers that extend from South Street.

June 26, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Southeast.

text:

June 26, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Southeast.

text:
59 Wall Street, (Wall and Hanover Building); Hanover Street, east side, from Wall to Beaver Streets, (general view northwestward).

Two views across Wall Street towards Broadway and City Hall park, showing there the prominent Transportation, Woolworth and Municipal Buildings.

At the left margin is a portion of the National City Building (No. 52 Wall Street) overlooking the elongated Federal Reserve.

June 26, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Northwest.

Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Northwest.

text:
59 Wall Street, (Wall and Hanover Building); Hanover Street, east side, from Wall to Beaver Streets, (general view northward).

In the center of View 1 is the Municipal Building. At the left and right margins appear portions of the Federal Reserve and No. 111 John Street buildings. The latter, completed recently, appears to better advantage in View 2. On the opposing side of Pearl Street are the smokestacks and plant of the New York Steam Company.

June 26, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - North.

text:

title: General view - Wall Street - North.

text:
59 Wall Street (The Wall and Hanover (Brown Bros.) Building): Hanover Street, east side, from Wall to Beaver Streets (general view southeastward).
This triangular area, Coenties Slip, extends eastward from Pearl Street to its base at South Street and has Jeannette Park and the "El" loop therein. The former occupies the easterly portion and the latter the apex. To the left is the East River merging into the Upper Bay at Governor's Island which appears in the distance.

August 28, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Wall Street - Southeast.

title: General view - Wall Street - Southeast.

text:
(1)
Bird's eye view of Governor's Island, seen from the roof of Brown Brothers, at Wall and Hanover Streets; during a hazy day.

June 26, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Wintry scene of Governor's Island and harbor, as seen from atop No. 60 Wall Street, five years later.

February 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same view, several days later, showing the huge ice floes surrounding Governor's Island.

February 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Governors Island - Bird's-eye-view.
